title: Looking for an high elo player who has the time to play a game with me
body: I want to learn what high elo players do that are different from those of bronze/silver elo. I think that playing a game with a high elo player may help me improve my mechanics and knowledge of the game. If someone would be kind enough to help please send me a friend request and we could play a game together.

replies.body: Chuck me an invite, I can answer questions/play a normal when I'm free.
u can always look for professional coaching, most people dont want to spend their time on something that doesnt show dedication or is worth their time
TYVM for this comment, I will try some of this advice.

The best thing I will say as an ex-diamond player is that a high elo player wont really help you out unless they're there to help you out. (I decayed out since I didn't play for 60~70 days.) If you want to improve mechanically playing games that require on-point timing is a good way [ OSU (Mouse) / Dance Dance Revolution (Keyboard) / DustForce (Keyboard) / CS:GO Training Maps (Mouse) ] The Genre types to look out for is platforms for keyboard sided mechanics and shooters for mouse. I've actually made a guide with some general mechanics in it: [Click here to go to it!](http://boards.oce.leagueoflegends.com/en/c/gameplay-strategy/tTVITxxq-a-newbie-and-general-mechanical-guide-to-league)

Game knowledge can be taught but it'll just be faster to look up a guide on the champs you want to play go through 5 of them to learn majority of the tricks and tip, perhaps watch a player who likes to push their main to the limits E.g: BoxBox.

I use lolking for when I learn a new champion but I don't use the pros I use people with 2k rating since they focus more on what the champion can do and not what the pros do to win. That being said I already know how to win... So I kinda got that going for me already.

I hope this can help, sorry for the late reply and feel free to ask anything and I'll try my best to help.

tl;dr:
[My guide on basic / general mechanics for league of legends.](http://boards.oce.leagueoflegends.com/en/c/gameplay-strategy/tTVITxxq-a-newbie-and-general-mechanical-guide-to-league)
[Look up a champion's guide and learn the tricks of the 2k elo players.](http://www.lolking.net/guides/)
Please excuse the grammatical error in the title.
